id.label: Id
id.description:
TODO type changed
Unique identifier of the service

category.label: Category
category.description: Is it a customer facing or resource facing service

hasStarted.label: Has Started
hasStarted.description: If TRUE, this Service has already been started

isBundle.label: Is Bundle
isBundle.description: If true, the service is a ServiceBundle which regroup a service hierachy. If false, the service is a 'atomic' service (hierachy leaf).

isServiceEnabled.label: Is Service Enabled
isServiceEnabled.description: If FALSE and hasStarted is FALSE, this particular Service has NOT been enabled for use - if FALSE and hasStarted is TRUE then the service has failed

isStateful.label: Is Stateful
isStateful.description: If TRUE, this Service can be changed without affecting any other services

serviceDate.label: Service Date
serviceDate.description: Date when the service was created (whatever its status).

startMode.label: Start Mode
startMode.description: This attribute is an enumerated integer that indicates how the Service is started, such as: 0: Unknown; 1: Automatically by the managed environment; 2: Automatically by the owning device; 3: Manually by the Provider of the Service; 4: Manually by a Customer of the Provider; 5: Any of the above

feature.label: Feature
feature.description: A list of feature associated with this service

note.label: Note
note.description: A list of notes made on this service

place.label: Place
place.description: A list of places (Place [*]). Used to define a place useful for the service (for example a geographical place whre the service is installed)

relatedEntity.label: Related Entity
relatedEntity.description: A list of related  entity in relationship with this service

relatedParty.label: Related Party
relatedParty.description: A list of related party references (RelatedParty [*]). A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity

serviceCharacteristic.label: Service Characteristic
serviceCharacteristic.description: A list of characteristics that characterize this service (ServiceCharacteristic [*])

serviceOrderItem.label: Service Order Item
serviceOrderItem.description: A list of service order items related to this service

serviceRelationship.label: Service Relationship
serviceRelationship.description: A list of service relationships (ServiceRelationship [*]). Describes links with other service(s) in the inventory.

serviceSpecification.label: Service Specification
serviceSpecification.description: The specification from which this service was instantiated

state.label: State
state.description: The life cycle state of the service, such as designed, reserved, active, etc...

supportingResource.label: Supporting Resource
supportingResource.description: A list of supporting resources (SupportingResource [*]).Note: only Service of type RFS can be associated with Resources

supportingService.label: Supporting Service
supportingService.description: A list of supporting services (SupportingService [*]). A collection of services that support this service (bundling, link CFS to RFS)

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.label: @schema Location
@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.label: @type
@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

@baseType.label: @base Type

@type.label: @type

TmfService_Create.description:
Service is a base class for defining the Service hierarchy. All Services are characterized as either being possibly visible and usable by a Customer or not. This gives rise to the two subclasses of Service: CustomerFacingService and ResourceFacingService.
Skipped properties: id,href

TmfTimePeriod.title: Time Period

endDateTime.label: End Date Time
endDateTime.description: End of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format

startDateTime.label: Start Date Time
startDateTime.description: Start of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format

TmfTimePeriod.description: A period of time, either as a deadline (endDateTime only) a startDateTime only, or both

TmfError.title: Error

code.label: Code
code.description: Application relevant detail, defined in the API or a common list.

reason.label: Reason
reason.description: Explanation of the reason for the error which can be shown to a client user.

message.label: Message
message.description: More details and corrective actions related to the error which can be shown to a client user.

referenceError.label: Reference Error
referenceError.description: URI of documentation describing the error.

TmfError.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)
